conversation_summary: A perpetual party smolders in amber light, walls breathing like lungs. Beaded veils drape mirrors that fracture the resurrected spectator into Harry, self, and absence. Smoke coils from an ever-burning joint; refilling glasses clink like distant bells. A clipboard-toting creative director times your borrowed heartbeat—thu-thump, thu-thump—while guests whisper that coming back is the real death.
